0.user_question: Dave had to wash 9 short sleeve shirts and 27 long sleeve shirts before school. If he had only washed 20 of them by the time school started, how many did he not wash?

ost_step.1: Identify the total number of shirts Dave had to wash. He had 9 short sleeve shirts and 27 long sleeve shirts. So, he had 9 (short sleeve shirts) + 27 (long sleeve shirts) = 36 shirts to wash.
ost_step.2: Identify the number of shirts Dave washed before school. The problem states he had washed 20 shirts.
ost_step.3: Subtract the number of shirts he washed from the total number of shirts to find out how many he didn't wash.
ost_step.4: Therefore, Dave did not wash 36 (total number of shirts) - 20 (shirts he washed) = 16 shirts.
